name: Turkic Mythology - Wolf with Female Shaman
description:
Wolf is one of the most important figures in Turkic Mythology makes that feel little bit fear. The wolf symbol for existence as a totem is sustained by magnifying the main aspect of descent. As the helping spirits of the kams (shamans), they are indispensable to their drums. It is known that the kams fighting the enemy and even the patriarchs and saints in Turkish Legends turned into wolves.
It has always been said that seeing wolves either in a dream or in reality, it is a sign of abundance.
In pre-islamic era, the wolf used to symbolize power and domination in the artistic and everyday motifs of Turkic life.

Illustration by Ozan Bilaloğlu - 2021
